div1.head: Biography
div1.p: Robert P. Bryarly kept a diary from November 1863, when he turned 20 years old, to November 1864. He titled his diary "Notes of my twenty-first year," and in it he provides accounts of his service in Company B of the 1st Virginia Cavalry. Bryarly briefly chronicles troop movements, skirmishes with the enemy, visits to relatives while on furlough, and the deaths of comrades. The diary ends with an injury in late 1864. According to a register of the Confederate Hospital at Charlottesville, Virginia, Bryarly returned to duty on April 7, 1865.

div3.head: Nov. 18th
div3.p: twentieth birthday, ordered to move camp, orders countermanded.

div3.head: 19th
div3.p: Moved camp about a mile + encamp near Rapid Ann River.

div3.head: From the 20th to 26th
div3.p: In camp, all quiet. Evening of the 26th moved camp; passed through Orange Court house to Moreton's ford, on Rapid Ann R.

div3.head: 27th
div3.p: Enemy crossed at Raccoon ford, were driven back

div3.head: 28th, 29th + 30th-
div3.p: Slight skirmishing at the ford.
At Raccoon ford.

div3.head: 3d
div3.p: Returned to camp near Orange, C.H.

div3.head: 4th, 5th + 6th-
div3.p: In camp.

div3.head: 7th + 8th-
div3.p: At Madison C. H.
In camp.

div3.head: 11th
div3.p: Moved camp passed through Barboursville; encamped near there for the night.

div3.head: 12th
div3.p: Marched to within 2 miles of Charlottesville.

div3.head: 13th
div3.p: In camp, nothing for our horses to eat.

div3.head: 14th
div3.p: Started for the Valley, sent back with detail for rations. overtook command near White Hall, crossed Blue Ridge Mountains, at Brown's gap. Marching nearly all night, very cold. Encamped near Port Republic.

div3.head: 15th
div3.p: Marched about 3 miles above Mt. Sydney. encamped for the night.--

div3.head: 16th
div3.p: Moved at Sunrise towards Staunton, halted near there in the afternoon, returned nearby to Mt. Crawford.

div3.head: 17th
div3.p: Moved at sunrise towards Staunton, passed through the town, on towards Greenville. sleeting quite fast all day. went into camp near the latter place about nine oclock at night. Ordered to move at twelve oclock. Ration of whiskey issued to Brigades. Moved at 12 oclock, (still sleeting, very fast.) -in the direction of Lexington arrived there on the morning of the 18th - fed; and passed through the town. Encamped near the town for the night.

div3.head: 19th
div3.p: Moved on through Colierstown to Buchanan. Halted. Ordered to move at 12 oclock at night.

div3.head: 20th
div3.p: Passed through Fincastle, marching all day, and night.

div3.head: 21st
div3.p: Arrived at Covington, halted and fed. Then moved on the warm spring road. Encamped about fifteen miles from the town.

div3.head: 22nd
div3.p: Marched on all day, + encamped at night near the Big Cow pasture river.

div3.head: 23rd
div3.p: Moved on to Bath Alum Springs. encamped for the night.

div3.head: 24th
div3.p: Passed thorough Brownsburg. The citizens distributed any amount of provisions among the troops at night encamped near Greenville. Went to Church.

div3.head: 25th
div3.p: Passed through Staunton and encamped near the Willow pump for the night.

div3.head: 26th
div3.p: Marched on to Harrisonburg. at night encamped near there.

div3.head: 27th
div3.p: Moved to New Market.

div3.head: 28th
div3.p: Moved camp below town
In camp, all quiet

div3.head: 31st
div3.p: Started for Moorefield in Hardy County.

div3.head: January 1st 1864.
div3.p: Encamped about 12 oclock at night about 3 miles south of Moorefield. Marching very bad on account of ice, and cold weather,

div3.head: 2d
div3.p: In camp; very cold.

div3.head: 3d
div3.p: Moved towards Petersburg, captured a train of wagons, and eighty-four prisoners, where the road from Moorefield intersects the Petersburg and New creek grade; Encamped near there for the night.

div3.head: 4th
div3.p: Went to Burlington stayed near there all night.

div3.head: 5th
div3.p: Marched to Ridgeville or Ridgeview snowing quite fast, encamped there all night.

div3.head: 6th
div3.p: Started for Newcreek at daylight after marching four or five miles. The orders were countermanded, (on account of bad weather) returned to Burlington.

div3.head: 7th
div3.p: Passed through Romney on to Brown's Gap settlement, encamped for the night.

div3.head: 8th
div3.p: Moved and encamped about 8 miles from Harrisonburg

div3.head: 9th
div3.p: Moved within one mile of town, had my ankle badly sprained by my horse falling on it.

div3.head: 10th
div3.p: The 5 Valley companies of my Regt. disbanded for ten days.

div3.head: 11th
div3.p: Started for my uncles in Albemarle county. spent the night with Mr. Brown, at Brown's Gap.
Arrived at my Uncle's. From 12th to 21st at my Uncles.

div3.head: 21st
div3.p: Started for camp near Charlottesville.

div3.head: 22d
div3.p: Regt. disbanded with the exception of companies A. B. F. + K. From 22d to 31st. In camp, drilling, and dress parade every day.

div3.head: February 1st
div3.p: In camp.

div3.head: 2d.
div3.p: Started for my Uncle Richard Bryarly in Rockbridge Co. on an 8 days furlough. Arrived there on the 3d.
At my Uncles

div3.head: 8th-
div3.p: Started for camp, overtook Regt. near Barborsville on the 12th.

div3.head: 13th
div3.p: Went in to camp near Orange Court H. From 13th to 17th. In camp.

div3.head: 17th
div3.p: Regiment on Picket, on river.
On Picket

div3.head: 20th
div3.p: Relieved and returned to camp. From 20th to 28th- In camp,

div3.head: 28th
div3.p: Yankees drove in our picket at Madison Court house. ordered out with 2 days rations, Moved across Rapid Ann river at Liberty Mills. encamped near there for the night.

div3.head: 29th
div3.p: Moved back across river, above Somerset, halted about three hours. Afternoon Marched on by Barborsville, Stonypoint, and Ruckersville, moving nearly all night, (raining very fast) halted about Stanardsville.

div3.head: March 1st
div3.p: Had a skirmish with Custers Brigade, In which we were driven back. 2d Va Cav. behaved very cowardly. Jas. L. Kearfort- mortally wounded and Triplet A. Paine taken prisoner from my Co. fell back to Jack's shop, Regt. on Picket at night

div3.head: 2d
div3.p: Returned to Camp, fed our horses. and in the afternoon started towards Chancellorsville after Kilpatrick. Encamped at night near Vidiersville.

div3.head: 3d
div3.p: Moved on to Chancellorsville
My Co on picket at Ely's ford.

div3.head: 5th
div3.p: Returned to camp.

div3.head: From 6th to the 30th
div3.p: In Camp. drilling, and dress parade every day. all quiet.

div3.head: April 1st to 26th-
div3.p: In camp. All quiet.

div3.head: 26th-
div3.p: Moved camp towards Fredericksburg, encamped near Chancellorsville at night

div3.head: 27th
div3.p: Marched to Hamiltons crossing.
in camp, drill, and dress parade
on Guard, raining quite fast,

div3.head: 3d
div3.p: In camp.

div3.head: 4th-
div3.p: Yankees, Yankees crossed Rapid Ann. Brigade moved out on Telegraph road, towards Chancellorsville.

div3.head: 5th
div3.p: Marched by Massassonas church towards Spottsylvania Court house. thence to Todds Tavern. heavy skirmishing by Lomas' Brigade, my squadron on Picket at night.

div3.head: 6th
div3.p: Infantry fighting near Mine run. Heavy skirmishing near Todds Tavern with enemies infantry.

div3.head: 7th
div3.p: Heavy fighting by my Div. Col. Pro Collins of 15th Va Cav. Killed.

div3.head: 8th
div3.p: Had a severe fight relieved by Longstreet's corps. A. P. Armstrong of my co. severely wounded.

div3.head: 9th
div3.p: Had a severe fight with Yankees Infantry. had 3 men wounded my co.: Corpl Seivest and Pri Frieze A. J. severely and M. L. Payne slightly. In afternoon started after Sheridan's raiding party towards Richmond. had a fight with their Rear guard, marching all night. Maj. Woolridge of 3d Va Cavalry wounded.

div3.head: May 10th
div3.p: Fighting all day. Sargt. G. W. Marshall severely wounded (of my co.) near Childsburg,

div3.head: 11th-
div3.p: Found enemy destroying railroad at Ashland, drove him off. followed them to Chickahomminy; Had severe fight at Half Sink bridges, In which we were repulsed. We lost Maj. Gen J. E. B. Stewart, Col. Pate of the 5th Va Cav. Also our beloved Capt. G. N. Hammond, and Privates Kilmer and Stump slightly wounded. our loss in officers and was very heavy.

div3.head: 12th
div3.p: Fighting near Meadow Bridge. Afternoon my brigade moved on to the old Rappahannock stage road. Encamped for the night on Hanover and Richmond road. Gen. Stewart died from his wounds.

div3.head: 13th
div3.p: In camp near Machanicsville

div3.head: 14th
div3.p: In Camp.

div3.head: 15th
div3.p: Moved near Richmond.

div3.head: 16th
div3.p: Moved towards Jas. River, passed by Seven Pines on to the Charles city road, stopped and grazed, encamped at night 4 miles from Richmond.

div3.head: 17th
div3.p: Grazing all day, Capt. Hammond died about 4 oclock in the morning.

div3.head: 18th
div3.p: Grazing until evening, then moved. Moved to Machanicsville.

div3.head: 19th
div3.p: Moving all day and parts of the night.

div3.head: 20th-
div3.p: Grazing near Atlees Station. Yankees reported at Hanover Courthouse in evening when we arrived they had gone, encamped there for the night.

div3.head: 21st
div3.p: Went to Peaks turnout Yks come to Court house soon after we left. started back, but found that they had been driven back by Maryland line. Encamped on Gen. Wickham's farm.

div3.head: 22nd
div3.p: Grazed and returned to Atlee's station in the evening.

div3.head: 23rd
div3.p: A detail from Div. sent to Kinnon landing on James river, rest of Div. went to Wickham's plantation

div3.head: 24th, 25th, + 26th-
div3.p: In Camp. Grazing.

div3.head: 27th
div3.p: Saddled up and moved out near Hanover Courthouse. In evening went to Atlee's station,

div3.head: 28th.
div3.p: Had severe fight near Old Church relieved by Breckinridges Infantry.

div3.head: 29th
div3.p: Lost one man from my co. on Picket (W. H. Janney)

div3.head: 30th
div3.p: Grazing all day at night encamped near Atlee's station. Moved to Coal Harbour. had severe fighting.

div3.head: June 1st.
div3.p: In camp near Coal Harbour.

div3.head: 2d
div3.p: Fortifying on our right. relieved by infantry in the evening. and moved to Bottoms Ridge.

div3.head: 3d
div3.p: In camp near there. acting O. S. of Co.

div3.head: 4th
div3.p: Grazing at 12 oclk; moved to York river railroad bridge. threw up fortifications near it, raining quite fast.

div3.head: 5th-
div3.p: Moved out on the road to White Oak swamp, about three miles, and encamped.

div3.head: 6th
div3.p: Regt. went on picket at Lampser Ell bridge.

div3.head: 7th
div3.p: On picket musquitoes very bad. Relieved by 2d Va Cav.

div3.head: 8th
div3.p: In camp. All quiet. Moved at 12 oclock at night. Moving all night.

div3.head: 9th
div3.p: Stopped and fed near Richmond. thence to Ashland, drew horse feed and rations marched nearly all night. stopped near Beaverdam station.

div3.head: 10th
div3.p: Marched on to Fredericks Hall, stopped and fed, and rested about three hours. Then to Louisa C. H. encamped for the night.

div3.head: 11th
div3.p: Marched towards Orange Court house, met the Yankees and drove them back. had a severe fight at Railroad about three miles from Louisa C. H., at night went to Gen. Hampton near Trevillians depot.
drew rations. In the evening had quite a severe fight and whipped the Yks severely. Fight until 9 oclck at night. My Regt in breast started home. Spent the night near Criglersville.

div3.head: 14th
div3.p: Went to Flint Hill.

div3.head: 15th
div3.p: Thence to Howellsville, crossed Shenandoah river, there by White-fish and Brucetown to Mr. Cunningham's, arrived there at daylight.

div3.head: 16th
div3.p: In woods near Mr. C's went home that night.

div3.head: 17th
div3.p: In woods, near home, went to the house at night.

div3.head: 19th
div3.p: In woods near Darkesville, had a splendid time, young ladies brought plenty cake and lemonade, at night captured a horse and went up to Mr. C's.

div3.head: 20th
div3.p: In woods near Mr. C's saw Miss S & P. P. At night - I started for Dixie. rode all night.

div3.head: 21st
div3.p: Crossed Shenandoah and spent the night with Mr. Downing near Chester Gap.

div3.head: 22d
div3.p: came to Puebla Mills.

div3.head: 23d
div3.p: Went to Criglersville spent the night with Mr. Berry.

div3.head: 24th
div3.p: Came about 3 miles south of Stanardsville.

div3.head: 25th
div3.p: Arrived at my Uncle's Farm

div3.head: From 25th to 2d July
div3.p: at my Uncles.

div3.head: 2d
div3.p: Started for camp. spent the night at Mr. Woodards near the Goochland line.

div3.head: 3d
div3.p: came by Goochland C. H. to Judes Ferry.

div3.head: 4th
div3.p: Crossed James River at Jude's Ferry. Ate breakfast at Mr. Dubelles who married a cousin of Miss M. S. passed through Powhatan county into Chesterfield into Chesterfield by Huguenot Springs, thence by Clover Hill Summit.

div3.head: 5th
div3.p: To Exeter Mills where I crossed Appomattox river. There on the Nazarene road to camp near Ream's station.

div3.head: 6th
div3.p: Went out where co was guarding some forage, came to camp in evening From 6th to 11th- In camp. Drill + dress parade.

div3.head: 11th
div3.p: Went to Ream's station to reinforce pickets

div3.head: 12th
div3.p: Out as reserve pickets.

div3.head: 13th
div3.p: Came to camp
In camp. 2 drills and 2 dress parades daily.

div3.head: 17th
div3.p: Went to Reams Station to reinforce pickets whilst train was replaced on track.

div3.head: 18th
div3.p: Went to camp.

div3.head: 19th
div3.p: In camp

div3.head: 20th
div3.p: came on Picket. had false alarm.

div3.head: 21st
div3.p: On Picket all quiet.

div3.head: 22d
div3.p: Relieved by 2d Va Cavalry, + returned to camp.

div3.head: 23 + 24th -
div3.p: In camp

div3.head: 25th
div3.p: On guard

div3.head: 26th
div3.p: Relieved from guard
Started at night. Stopped near Petersburg, + fed.

div3.head: 29th
div3.p: crossed Jas. river. camped near Drewry's Bluff.

div3.head: 30th
div3.p: Marched towards Seven Pines after going six miles returned to the place where we encamped the previous night.

div3.head: 31st
div3.p: In camp. In evening moved across Jas. river at Chaffins Bluffs Moving nearly all night, stopped near Petersburg. All quiet.

div3.head: 1st
div3.p: Passed through town to old camp near Reams station. I stopped in town, ate dinner, at Mr. D. Paynes.

div3.head: 2d
div3.p: In Camp. Slight showers.

div3.head: 3d
div3.p: Our interior guard O. S. Murphy made adjt.

div3.head: 4th
div3.p: In camp

div3.head: 5th
div3.p: Started towards Richmond. stopped and fed about 4 miles beyond Petersburg, + fed.

div3.head: 6th
div3.p: Marched and camped near Winchester.

div3.head: 7th
div3.p: Passed through Richmond with jackets buttoned up and drawn sabres. Camped near Ashland, for the night.

div3.head: 8th
div3.p: Marched on, + encamped near Beaver dam station.

div3.head: 9th
div3.p: Drew two days rations of horsefeed, moved on and encamped near Andersons Tavern for the night. Drew two days rations.

div3.head: 10th
div3.p: Moved on by Vidiersville to Sommersville ford on Rapid Ann. raining very fast.

div3.head: 12th
div3.p: In camp until 5 ock then detailed as escort to go to Clark Co. travelled all night. Stopped near Flint Hill and fed.

div3.head: 13th
div3.p: Marched on all day crossed river at Front Royal, ran into a party of Yanks at Cedarville. they chased me to the river. In evening went down river to Howellsville.

div3.head: 14th
div3.p: Returned to Front Royal. In evening started on a scout - came to Howellsville.

div3.head: 15th
div3.p: Stayed near Millwood. At night came to the Opequon near Mr. Ewell's.

div3.head: 16th
div3.p: Stayed there and at Mrs. Bell's until night. passed by home.

div3.head: 17th
div3.p: Stayed in Pine hills. At night went by Henson's Mills to the Martinsburg Pike.

div3.head: (on the morning of the 18th)
div3.p: near Joe Branson's Then to Brucetown on to Mr. Bell's In evening to Winchester reported to Gen. Lee that night.

div3.head: 19th
div3.p: Had my horse shod in Winchester. Then went down near Shepherdstown. came back to Mr. C's reported to Gen. Lee.

div3.head: 20th
div3.p: Went across Opequon at Sulphur spring ford.

div3.head: 21st
div3.p: ate breakfast at Uncle Sam's, Yks in Smithfield. Our forces drove Yks from Smithfield, went to Leetown. then to Berryville to Gen Lee's Hd Qtrs.

div3.head: 22nd
div3.p: went home

div3.head: 23rd
div3.p: at home

div3.head: 24th
div3.p: Went to Leetown as guide for Gen. Lee (Fitz.) Went to Martinsburg by Burn's Ford. Then to Hainsville.

div3.head: 26th
div3.p: Drove Yks across Potomac river then moved to Billmyer's mill went home.

div3.head: 27th
div3.p: at home

div3.head: 28th
div3.p: Came to Brigade at Brucetown. Yks advancing.

div3.head: 29th
div3.p: Horse badly pricked very lame

div3.head: 30th
div3.p: Put in horse detail.

div3.head: 31st
div3.p: In camp saddled up

div3.head: Sept. 1st
div3.p: With broken down horse at Burn a factory in Opequon skirmishing in Winchester and Berryville Pike.

div3.head: 2d
div3.p: Went to see my Grandmama.

div3.head: 3d
div3.p: Started on horse detail to Albemarle Co. Spent the night at Woodstock.

div3.head: 4th
div3.p: Came on above New Market thence on Resiltown road.

div3.head: 5th
div3.p: crossed Ridge at Brown's Gap spent the night with Mr. Brown.

div3.head: 6th
div3.p: Came to my uncle's in Albemarle Co.

div3.head: 7th
div3.p: At my Uncle's.

div3.head: 8th
div3.p: Started for camp. Spent the night at Mr. William Rhodes.

div3.head: 9th
div3.p: Came through Brown's Gap. Spent the night with Mr. Sommers near Resiltown.

div3.head: 10th
div3.p: Came to Edinburg spent the night, ate breakfast at Wood stock dined at Cousin Dav Miller's, spent the night at Uncle Jno. S. M.

div3.head: 12th
div3.p: Went to Winchester + returned to Uncle Jno.

div3.head: 13th
div3.p: Went to see my sweetheart.

div3.head: 14th
div3.p: Went to camp.

div3.head: 15th
div3.p: Detailed as guard at my Uncles.
On guard.

div3.head: 19th
div3.p: Early was whipped. At night I went to Middletown.

div3.head: 20th
div3.p: Overtook my Brigade at Front Royal.

div3.head: 21st
div3.p: Yks drove our pickets from the town. We moved back to about 12 miles from Luray.

div3.head: 22nd
div3.p: Fortifying and fighting all day. drove Yks back.

div3.head: 23rd
div3.p: Came on through Luray camped near there for the night.

div3.head: 24th
div3.p: Marched across mountain towards New Market. Early still falling back. Brigade returned to Luray Valley. moved on the road to Conrads store. Squadron on picket. Brigade encamped near there for the night.

div3.head: 25th
div3.p: Regt. left in breastworks at the river until 12 oclk at night, then overtook brigade near Magaccaville. squadron on picket until 12 oclk at night.

div3.head: 26th
div3.p: Moved on to Port Republic then to Brown's Gap. At night went about 4 miles towards Rockfish Gap.

div3.head: 27th
div3.p: Moved out near Weyer's cave. had severe skirmish three horses killed in Co. B. drove Yks back across North river. Came back across North branch Shenandoah river.

div3.head: 28th
div3.p: Came to Rockfish Gap. Squadron on picket. Brigade drove Yks from Waynesboro.

div3.head: 29th
div3.p: Camped on the Greenville Road.

div3.head: 30th
div3.p: Came to Staunton in evening went back on Waynesboro road. encamped at Christian's creek.

div3.head: October 1st.
div3.p: Came through Staunton to Mt. Sydney on picket and advance guard. at night on picket, Centreville.

div3.head: 2d
div3.p: Had a skirmish at Bridgewater. Drove Yks across river, camped for the night near Centreville.

div3.head: 3d
div3.p: In camp until 2 oclk then went to Bridgewater. Encamped near there for the night.

div3.head: 4th
div3.p: Moved out near river to support picket. In evening my squadron went on picket.

div3.head: 5th
div3.p: On picket, relieved by 2d Va Cav., went to camp.

div3.head: 6th
div3.p: Advanced to Brocks Gap, drove Yks across north branch Shenandoah river. nearly every barn burned and same for houses. camped near there for the night.

div3.head: 7th
div3.p: Moved on the back road. captured several wagons and a great many sheep. Encamped for the night near Forrestville.
Fighting all day near Fishershill. I was severely wounded in right arm in the evening. very cold. stayed at field hospital during the night.

div3.head: 9th
div3.p: Started for General Hospital at Charlottesville. Rosser badly whipped lost all his artillery and wagons, spent the night at Mr. Hollers.

div3.head: 10th
div3.p: Arrived at Brigewater, spent the night at Mr. Miller's. had my arm dressed at Dayton.

div3.head: 11th
div3.p: Came to Spring Hill. had my arm dressed by Dr. Bell. stayed with Mr. Theophilus Gamble until the 17th, (very kindly treated by his family, also by Dr. Bell,) Then started for Charlottesville, spent the night at Brooksville, next came to my Uncle's in Albemarle County

div3.head: 20th
div3.p: Went to the Hospital, wound doing well. Remained in hospital until 1st Nov. then came to Bluefield.

div3.head: 3d
div3.p: had a chill

div3.head: 4th
div3.p: had another, arm much worse.

div3.head: 9th
div3.p: Returned to hospital. I spent my 21st birthday in Ward K, bed No. 26th, 1st Division Delivan Hospital, Charlottesville, Albemarle County, Virginia.

div2.p: I certify that this is a true account of my wandering's from Nov. 18th, 1864, to No 18th 1864. That is to the best of my knowledge.

Corporal, Robert P. Bryarly.
Co. (B), 1st Va Cav
Wickham's Brigade
Fitz Lee's Div.

Witness
M. L. Van Dorn
Co (B) 1st Va Cav
Wickham Brigade
